intro: Tristicha, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzag-shaped stems that add visual interest to gardens. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple, which bloom in clusters. Tristicha thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil, making it a versatile choice for ornamental gardening.
